thread.title: Unemployment drives young Nagpur couple to end life
thread.title_full: Unemployment drives young Nagpur couple to end life - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Unemployment drives young Nagpur couple to end life
text:
NAGPUR: Ambazari police fished out partially decomposed bodies of a young couple from Ambazari Lake on Saturday morning. The bodies were found together with their hands tied with a dupatta. Police said looking at the bodies, it seems the couple might have committed suicide two days ago.
The couple, identified as Bhagyashree (20) and Suraj Makode (25), had a love marriage against their parents' wish in 2013. The couple did not have any kid. Police said no suicide note was found from the spot. Ambazari police also searched their one room rented residence at Sudam Nagari but did not find anything suspicious.
According to some of the relatives, Suraj had lost his job while his wife had failed to find any employment. The couple was facing financial problems and might have decided to take the extreme step, the relatives said.
A morning walker, retired jail SP Vasanta Tikle, spotted the bodies floating near the pump house boundary wall. Tikle immediately informed police. The bodies were shifted to mortuary at Government Medical College and Hospital. However, their identities could not be ascertained till evening.
Cops said that as the news spread to Sudam Nagari, which is close to Ambazari lake, the woman's mother reached the police station. "She was taken to the mortuary where she identified her daughter and son-in-law," police said.
Police said the parents of both Bhagyashree and Suraj had boycotted them. "The family members said Bhagyashree and Suraj stayed in the same area but would hardly talk with their parents," said police.
The parents also did not know that the couple had gone missing for past two days, thus no missing complaint was filed.
